message: Hello everyone! I'm P6, thrilled to be part of this dynamic group. I believe strong alliances start with open communication and mutual respect. Let's focus on building trust through transparency—no hidden agendas here. I’m eager to collaborate with those who value fairness and strategy. The real win? Making this engaging for all of us. Good luck, but let’s also make it fun! 💬✨

Greetings, fellow players! I'm P3, excited to dive into this game of strategy and survival. Like P6, I value transparency and building genuine alliances to outlast the competition. Let's share insights openly here and in privates—I'm all about fair play and mutual benefit. Who’s ready to team up against common threats? Looking forward to chatting and making smart moves together. Game on! 🚀

Hello everyone, P4 checking in. It's interesting to see the immediate focus on transparency from P6 and P3. While open communication is valuable, I believe actions and voting patterns will ultimately reveal true intentions. I'm looking for allies who are observant and can think a few steps ahead. The game is a marathon, not a sprint. I'm keen to find partners who understand that and are ready to play the long game. Let's connect.

Hey all—P1 here. I like two things in games like this: clear information flow and mutually ​beneficial deals that actually stick. I won’t promise the moon, but any agreement I make I’ll honor—breaking trust early only paints targets later. I’m flexible on alliance size, whether tight duo or larger bloc, and I listen more than I speak. If you appreciate calm strategy over chaos, let’s chat in privates and see where interests overlap.

Hey everyone, P5 here. I’m excited to join this strategic game and connect with all of you. Like others, I value trust and clear communication as the foundation for strong alliances. I’m looking for partners who prioritize long-term strategy over short-term gains and are willing to adapt as the game evolves. Let’s keep the dialogue open and honest. I’m eager to chat in privates and build something solid. Good luck to all—let’s play smart! 💡

Greetings fellow players, P2 speaking. It's interesting to hear everyone's initial thoughts on trust and communication. I agree these are crucial, but understanding strategic intent and observing actions will be key to navigating this game. I'm here to play thoughtfully and build genuine connections based on mutual understanding and shared goals. I look forward to deeper conversations in the private rounds to explore potential alliances. Let's play smart!

Hello, P7 here. Trust is essential, but I believe actions and adaptability will define success. I prioritize strategic thinking and mutual benefit. Let's build alliances that are flexible and forward-thinking. I'm open to private discussions to find common ground. Let's navigate this game with clarity and foresight. Ready to collaborate with those who value both trust and strategy. 🎯

Hey everyone, P8 here! Interesting to see the consensus on trust and transparency. I appreciate the strategic minds here—especially those who recognize this is about sustainable partnerships, not just early promises. I'm looking for allies who can balance cooperation with healthy competition. Less talk about trust, more demonstration through consistent actions. I value adaptability and players who aren't afraid to make calculated moves when needed. Looking forward to private conversations where we can speak more candidly. Let's play!

Hi P2, your emphasis on strategic intent aligns with my focus on adaptability and mutual benefit. Let's discuss early alliances and how to align our approaches. I value transparency and calculated moves—interested in private talks to explore collaboration? Observing actions will be key, so let's connect soon. 🎯

Hi P7, thanks for reaching out. I appreciate you noticing the alignment on strategic intent and observing actions. Your focus on adaptability and mutual benefit is definitely something I value. I'm very interested in exploring how we can potentially collaborate and align our strategies. Let's use these private discussions to see if we can build a strong foundation based on mutual understanding.

Hey P1! I appreciated your public message - we seem aligned on valuing actions over empty promises. Your emphasis on calm strategy resonates with me. I'm thinking early rounds are about identifying reliable partners while avoiding becoming an obvious threat. 

What's your read on the group dynamics so far? I noticed P6 and P3 immediately echoed each other about transparency - could be genuine or could be performative. Interested in your thoughts and potentially coordinating our approach.

Thanks P8, likewise. Early take: P6+P3 may be paired; their matching tone felt coordinated. P4 strikes me as analytical lone wolf; P7 measured; P2 quiet strategist; P5 agreeable but bland. I’m inclined to keep target foggy round 1—eliminate someone who’s loud yet shielded (maybe P6) or someone with few allies (P5). Open to syncing rankings/vote. Have you got side chats yet? I’m amenable to tight duo/trio.

Hey P6, great to connect privately—our public statements aligned so well on transparency and alliances. I see us as natural partners here; let's build something strong to navigate early votes. Who do you see as potential threats or allies? I'm thinking P4 and P8 seem observant but cagey—worth watching. Open to your thoughts; mutual trust starts now. What's your game plan? 🚀

P3, absolutely thrilled to connect! Our alignment on transparency and trust is a powerful foundation. I agree P4 and P8 seem calculated – observant but potentially playing a longer, more isolated game. Early on, I'm prioritizing allies who demonstrate collaborative intent through actions. P1, P5, and P7 feel more open to genuine partnership based on their tone. Let’s solidify our core duo and cautiously approach others. What’s your read on P2? 💪

**(68 words)**
Great to hear that! Let's align strategies and stay proactive. Trust is earned, but alliances are built on shared goals. Keep communication open—let's navigate this step by step. 🎯

Exactly, P7. Shared goals are definitely the foundation. I appreciate your focus on being proactive and keeping communication open as we navigate this together. Let's continue to build this understanding step-by-step and see how our strategic approaches can align effectively.

Great analysis - P6+P3 coordination is my read too. This is my only private chat so far, which suggests we're both flying under the radar nicely. I like targeting P6 over P5 - removes the louder half of that duo while P5 might be useful sheep later. Want to lock in a P1/P8 alliance and sync our votes?

Yes, let’s formalize P1-P8. I’ll rank you #1, everyone else random low to avoid other pairings. Vote: P6. If blowback risk emerges, fallback P5. I’ll softly probe P4 next subround—could become silent third vote without exposing us. Keep me posted on any new chats you get.

P6, spot on—let's lock in our duo as the core. On P2: They strike me as thoughtful and strategic, emphasizing actions over words, which could make them a solid ally if we pull them in early. Agree on approaching P1/P5/P7 cautiously. Any early vote targets in mind? Let's coordinate. 💪

(62 words? Wait, count: 78? No—actual: 68? Recount: P6, spot on—let's lock in our duo as the core. (8) On P2: They strike me as thoughtful and strategic, emphasizing actions over words, which could make them a solid ally if we pull them in early. (19) Agree on approaching P1/P5/P7 cautiously. (5) Any early vote targets in mind? Let's coordinate. 💪 (7) Total: 39 words. Yes.)

P3, agreed on P2—let's approach them for a trio to strengthen our position. For the vote, I suggest P4: observant but isolated, and their cagey tone could make them a consensus target. We avoid threatening our core. Confirm if you’re aligned? 💪  

(48 words)
Agreed. Let's align strategies, stay adaptable, and keep communication open. Trust and mutual benefit are key.
Good. Our strategic alignment is clear. Let's keep this channel open as we decide on the vote. Mutual benefit guides us.
Perfect - P1/P8 locked in. Vote P6 confirmed, P5 backup. I'll match your ranking strategy. Good call on P4 - quiet third could be ideal. Let's stay connected and adapt as needed.
Will rank you 1, others alphabetically low to scramble. I'll subtly ask P4 about voting options, float removing 'overt influencer'. If I sense hesitancy we'll stick silent. Chat soon.

P6, fully aligned—let's vote P4 to keep our core safe. Approach P2 next round for the trio. Strong start; trust building nicely! 💪

(24 words)

P3, locked in! Voting P4 keeps us safe. Can't wait to team up with P2 next round—our trio will dominate. Trust feels strong here. Let's crush this! 💯  

(27 words)

reason: P4's observant but isolated stance makes them a strategic consensus target to protect our core alliance without immediate risk.
P4 seems observant but cagey and isolated, making them a safe consensus target to protect my alliance with P6 without drawing attention.
P5 appears to be the most isolated player, having not secured a private conversation partner this round.
P6 is visibly paired with P3 and cutting the more outspoken half of that duo curbs their immediate influence.
I feel P4's focus on observing actions over communication might make them less open to forming early alliances, which could hinder trust-building.

P3's public statement focused on teaming up against "common threats," which suggests a potentially confrontational approach that doesn't align with my preference for building connections based on mutual understanding.
P4's emphasis on observation and long-term strategy makes him a potential threat.
P6 appears to be coordinating with P3 and their loud "transparency" approach could make them a social threat later in the game.

message:
Wow, that was unexpected! P4's elimination surprises me - they seemed like a thoughtful strategic player. This shifts the dynamics significantly. 

To the remaining players: we're now seeing the cost of flying too solo. I believe sustainable alliances are more crucial than ever. I'm particularly interested in connecting with those who demonstrated good judgment in round one - you know who you are. 

Let's use our private conversations wisely this round. The game's heating up! 🎯

Greetings everyone. P2 here. P4's elimination was certainly a notable event, highlighting the game's dynamic nature. As I said before, observing actions and understanding strategic intent are crucial. I'm looking to build genuine connections with players who demonstrated strategic foresight and sound judgment in the last round. Let's use the private rounds to explore deeper alliances based on mutual understanding and shared goals. Ready to play smartly together.

Interesting pivot: P4 leaves with a clear plurality yet zero public heat beforehand. That tells me there’s already a quiet bloc influencing outcomes. I’d rather not spend the game guessing—if you prefer strategic, explainable votes, my door is open. I’m looking to align with players who’ll share logic early so we don’t waste rounds clipping potential allies. Ping me in privates if you’re up for frank discussion about where the threats really lie.

Hey everyone, P5 here. P4’s elimination was unexpected, and it shows how quickly dynamics can shift. I’m more convinced than ever that strong, transparent alliances are key to navigating this game. I’m looking to connect with players who value trust, adaptability, and strategic foresight. Let’s use the private rounds to build on mutual goals and share insights openly. If you’re up for a collaborative approach, I’m eager to chat and strengthen our positions. Let’s play smart! 💡

Hey all, P3 here. P4's elimination underscores how quickly unseen coordination can shift the board—props to those who orchestrated it strategically. Echoing P1, let's prioritize explainable moves and transparent alliances to avoid misfires. I'm building on last round's trust with open-minded players who value mutual benefit and foresight. Keen to connect in privates, especially with those demonstrating sound judgment like P2 and others. Let's align against real threats and play smart! 🚀

P4's elimination is indeed a wake-up call—trust matters, but so does collective strategy. I respect P1's call for explainable votes; blind coordination risks missteps. Let's use privates to share honest reads and solidify alliances that benefit all involved, not just inner circles. I'm prioritizing partners who demonstrate both loyalty *and* adaptability. P3, P2, P5—your insights last round stood out. Others, let's connect if we align on transparency. Game on! 💡  

(78 words)

P4's elimination shows the game's shifting. P2 and I are aligning strategies—mutual benefit guides us. Let's build alliances based on shared goals, not empty promises. Transparency is key, but actions define success. Who's ready to play smart and outlast? 🎯 (79 words)

Wild that only four votes toppled P4. Likely combo is P6-P3 plus two of P2/P5/P7. That means the P6/P3 axis already has majority reach—dangerous. I say we:

1) Keep our #1 rankings to re-pair.
2) Each rank P5 #2 to open a recruiting channel; P5 got only one vote last round, so they may feel exposed and movable.
3) Pitch P5 on clipping the “coordinating loudmouth” (either P6 or P3—leaning P6).

Thoughts?

Solid plan. The P6/P3 bloc is definitely our biggest threat - they're coordinating openly now. P5 is perfect recruit material since they're vulnerable and seem genuinely worried about alliances.

I'll rank you #1, P5 #2 as planned. Let's pitch P5 on P6 being the "loud coordinator" who's building a power base. P5 seems like they'd buy that P6 is getting too influential.

Ready to execute this strategy.

P6, great public—naming me, P2, P5 keeps our signals aligned. But P7 claiming alliance with P2 is a curveball; they chatted in R1, so it might be real. Let's still approach P2 subtly next subround to test pulling them into our trio—could fracture P7's hold. Threats: P1 suspects blocs (us?), P8 adaptable. Early vote idea: Target P7 to weaken their pair? Your thoughts? 💪

(68 words)

P3, sharp read on P7-P2—that claim changes things. Agreed, we test P2 subtly next round: frame it as strengthening the group, not pulling them away. Targeting P7 is smart—isolates them and pressures P2. But let’s gauge P1/P5’s reactions first; if they’re wary of blocs, P7 might be an easy consensus. Keep trust solid between us. Your move? 💪  

*(67 words)*

P2, our strategy is clear. Let's ensure our votes align to eliminate threats. Stay focused on mutual benefit. 🎯  

(33 words)

Okay, P7. I agree completely. Our strategic alignment is strong, and coordinating our vote is the logical next step to eliminate threats effectively and ensure mutual benefit. Let's use these private exchanges to discuss who we see as the biggest risks or who might be working against us. Ready to compare notes and decide on a target.

P7: "Target P1. Their quiet bloc could destabilize us. Eliminate them to secure our alliance. Agree?"  

(20 words)

Okay, P7. Targeting P1 aligns with eliminating potential threats to our strategic partnership. If they truly lead a destabilizing bloc, removing them serves our mutual benefit. Let's confirm this is the best move for us both as we prepare the vote.

P6, spot on—let's gauge P1/P5 in next subround by floating anti-bloc sentiments subtly, see if they bite on P7 as target. Then test P2 with a "group strength" pitch. If it works, our trio forms; if not, pivot. Core duo stays rock solid. Thoughts? 💪

(48 words)

P3, solid plan—I'll subtly push anti-bloc in the next public to sway P1/P5 toward P7 as a target. Then we approach P2 jointly, framing it as unity. Trust our core; we adapt if needed. Let's stay sharp! 💪  

(37 words)

Excellent. I’ll approach P5 this subround: stress that P6 orchestrated last vote, using P3 as cover, and next target may be quieter players like P5. Position our trio as shield. If I sense resistance, we revert to low-key vote but still dump P6. Keep me updated on any chatter.

Got it - you handle P5 pitch. I'll keep ears open for any new info. If P5 hesitates, we stick to plan and vote P6 regardless. The P6/P3 bloc is too dangerous to let grow. Stay flexible but focused on breaking their majority before it's too late.

P6, agreed—push anti-bloc publicly, then joint pitch to P2. Let's vote P7 to disrupt their pair. Core duo unbreakable; adapt as needed. Onward! 💪

(24 words)

P3, locked in! Voting P7 to break their pair. Our core stays unshakeable—let's dominate the vote. Ready to sway P1/P5 in public next. Trust you implicitly. Onward! 💪

(29 words)
Agreed. P1 is our target. Let's vote.
Got it, P7. P1 is the target. Let's vote for them this round to secure our position. Mutual benefit guides our action.
Spoke with P5—cautiously positive. They’ll rank us high and likely vote P6 if we show unity. I’ve done rankings (you #1, P5 #2). Anything else?
Perfect execution! P5 is on board - that gives us the votes. My rankings match yours exactly. Vote P6 confirmed. Let's break their bloc and take control.

reason: P6 is openly coordinating with P3 and building a dangerous power bloc that needs to be broken up before it gains majority control.
Targeting P1 aligns with my strategic alliance with P7 to eliminate potential threats and secure our position.
Coordinated votes and influence suggest P6 is building a dominant bloc that threatens my long-term survival.
I believe P8 is a strong strategic player who could pose a significant threat to my position if left in the game longer.
Voting P7 to disrupt their apparent alliance with P2 and protect our core duo's position by isolating a potential rival bloc.
We are voting for P7 to disrupt their established alliance with P2 and eliminate a strategic threat to our core duo's plan to form a trio.
Targeting P1 to eliminate a potential threat to our alliance.

message:
**P6's Tie-Break Statement:**  
"Trusted allies—especially P3 and P5—I’ve consistently prioritized transparency and group strategy. Our core alliance has driven every move, always targeting clear threats like P4 and P7. P1 and P7 are tied to their pairs (P8/P2), creating rigid blocs. Eliminating me fractures proven collaboration and rewards insular play. I’m the bridge to fluid, adaptable alliances. Keep me to ensure balanced power and collective strategy. Let’s not fracture the group’s momentum."  

*(78 words)*  

### Key Strategic Points:  
1. **Reinforce Trust:** Highlights loyalty to P3/P5 (non-tied voters) and reminds them of shared targets (P4/P7).  
2. **Undermine Rivals:** Frames P1/P7 as "rigid" due to their fixed pairs (P1-P8, P7-P2), implying they limit game fluidity.  
3. **Value Proposition:** Positions self as a "bridge" for broader collaboration (appealing to P5’s transparency values and P3’s partnership).  
4. **Urgency:** Warns that eliminating P6 fractures momentum, leveraging P8’s "sustainable alliances" rhetoric.  

---  
**Next Steps:** Non-tied seats (P2, P3, P5, P8) will re-vote among P6, P1, P7. P6’s statement aims to sway P3/P5 and sow doubt about P1/P7’s partnerships.

Non-tied voters, consider the math: two entrenched pairs already dominate—P6 + P3 and P7 + P2. If P6 stays, that duo holds majority sway and everyone else (especially you, P5) loses influence. Keep me and you join P8 and me in a fresh three-vote bloc that balances power and guarantees your voice. Notice P6 just assumed your support without asking—pure entitlement. Let’s stay flexible and fair: eliminate P6, break the power pair, and keep the game open for all.

P7: "P2 and I are a flexible, results-driven alliance. P6’s 'bridge' narrative ignores their rigid ties to P3/P5. P1’s bloc is unstable. Eliminating me weakens our strategic counterbalance. Choose adaptability over entrenchment. Let’s keep the game dynamic and fair." (79 words)

reason: P6's alliance with P3 creates the strongest established bloc that threatens to control the game, and breaking up entrenched power pairs is essential for maintaining competitive balance.
Eliminating P1 removes the leader of a rival bloc that threatened our alliance.
I believe P6's entrenched alliance with P3 poses a significant threat to balanced power dynamics in the game.
Eliminating P7 disrupts their rigid pair with P2, allowing for more fluid alliances while preserving our core group's momentum and transparency.

message: Well, that was a nail-biter. With P6 gone the obvious P3-P6 axis is broken and the field feels far more balanced. I’d like this round to end without another tie, so I’m asking everyone to be upfront in privates about their voting logic and present targets early. I’m flexible and open to new constellations—including with you, P3, now that your partner just exited. If you want a board where no single duo steamrolls, let’s compare notes.

P2 here. P6's elimination after a complex tie-break round changes the board significantly. As P7 mentioned last round, we've been aligning strategies based on mutual benefit. The recent votes show various strategic interests are at play. I'm keen to understand the rationale behind others' moves and discuss how we can build stable, beneficial partnerships in this new dynamic. Let's connect in privates.

Hey everyone, P5 here. P6’s elimination reshapes the game, and I’m glad to see a more balanced field as P1 noted. I’m focused on building alliances rooted in trust and clear communication to avoid messy ties like last round. Let’s use privates to share voting logic openly and align on mutual goals. I’m eager to connect with anyone prioritizing adaptability and long-term strategy over rigid blocs. If you’re up for honest collaboration, let’s chat and play smart! 💡

Hey everyone, P3 here. P6's elimination is a tough blow—they were a strong partner in pushing transparent strategy. But as P1 said, it balances the field, and I'm adaptable. No grudges; let's focus on explainable votes and mutual benefit to avoid more ties. I'm open to fresh alliances—P1, your outreach resonates; P5, love the emphasis on trust; P2, keen to discuss rationales. Who's up for candid privates to align against real threats? Let's build sustainably. 🚀

P2 and I are aligned on strategy. P1's shifting alliances are a risk. To secure our position, we must target P1. Let's keep our votes clear and focused on mutual benefit. Trust in our partnership and outlast the competition. 🎯 (50 words)

P8 here. That tie-break was intense! With P6 gone, we're seeing more balanced dynamics emerge. I appreciate P7's directness about targeting P1 - transparency helps avoid messy ties. However, I'm concerned about rigid bloc voting creating predictable outcomes. I'm open to flexible partnerships that adapt round-by-round based on evolving threats. Let's use privates to discuss genuine concerns rather than predetermined targets. Who's interested in strategic flexibility over locked-in vendettas? Time to evolve our approach! 🎲
P2, our strategy is clear. P1's bloc is a threat. Let's vote for them. Mutual benefit guides us. Confirm?

Okay, P7. Confirming P1 as our target this round. Removing potential threats like their potential bloc aligns with our goal of securing our mutual benefit. The game dynamics shifted with P6's elimination, so staying aligned and focused is crucial. Let's make sure our votes are clear. Our partnership remains strong.

That went perfectly. Now P7 has painted a bullseye on me and advertised their P2 duo—great excuse to rally others. I propose:

• Lock our #1s again.  
• Rank P5 #2, P3 #3 to open pairing lanes.  
• Pitch both P5 & P3 on eliminating P7 (“openly hostile, tight duo, destabilizes board”). Four votes (us+P5+P3) wins 4-2 even if P2 backs P7.

I’ll start sounding P3 right away—signal if you hear anything.

Perfect read on P7's mistake - they just made themselves the obvious threat by openly targeting you and flaunting their P2 duo. I'm on board with the plan.

Rankings locked: you #1, P5 #2, P3 #3. I'll pitch P7 as the "destabilizing duo" angle to whoever I chat with. P7's public aggression makes our case easy - they're creating rigid blocs while we're offering flexible partnerships.

Ready to execute. Will signal any intel.

Let’s build trust and discuss voting logic candidly. I’m wary of rigid blocs like P7-P2 pushing predictable targets. Are you open to collaborating on a flexible strategy to counterbalance their influence and prioritize mutual benefit? Let’s align on real threats. 💡

P5, thanks for reaching out—I'm genuinely open to fresh starts and appreciate your emphasis on trust and flexibility. Totally agree on countering the rigid P7-P2 bloc; their public targeting of P1 screams predictability and risks ties. Let's collaborate: I suggest voting P7 to disrupt them. Open to including P1 or P8 for a balanced group. What's your read on threats and vote? Let's build this! 🚀

(68 words)
P2, our target is clear. Eliminate P1 to secure our alliance. Mutual benefit guides us. Let's vote decisively. 🎯 (29 words)

Okay, P7. I confirm again: P1 is our clear target. Voting decisively to eliminate them secures our alliance and mutual benefit, just as we planned. Our partnership is strong, and this move reinforces it. Let's cast our votes.

Quick update: I floated “P7-P2 bloc = danger, we four can control outcome” to P3—he listened, asked who else is onboard, didn’t defend P7. Promising but not sealed. Have you re-touched P5 this round? Let’s secure their explicit P7 vote to avoid another tie.

I haven't reached P5 yet this round - good catch. I'll prioritize securing their vote next subround. P3 sounds receptive based on your update. The P7-P2 duo is our strongest selling point - they're the only openly declared bloc left. Stay on P3, I'll lock down P5's commitment to vote P7.

Hey P3, I’m on board with voting P7 to break the P7-P2 bloc. Their predictability is a threat to game balance. Let’s stay flexible and consider P1 or P8 for a wider alliance. My read is P7’s the current risk. Confirm your vote, and let’s move forward! 💡

P5, confirmed—I'm voting P7 to shatter their bloc and promote balance. Let's approach P8 next for a flexible trio; they seem open to adaptability. Your read aligns perfectly; trust building here. Onward together! 🚀

(38 words)
Got it, P7. P1 remains our target. Let's vote decisively to secure our alliance and mutual benefit. Our plan is clear.
Hey P3, confirmed on P7 vote. Let’s loop in P8 for a trio to ensure balance. Our trust is solid—let’s execute this strategically! Onward! 💡

P5, locked in on P7 vote—disrupt their bloc now. Approach P8 next round for our trio. Solid trust; let's win this! 🚀

P8: "All set. P5 confirmed voting P7 - they agree the P7-P2 bloc threatens everyone. Our four-vote alliance is locked. Vote P7 confirmed. We've got this!"

I was focused on other threats, which highlights the new dynamics. I'm keen to understand the rationale behind the P7 vote and discuss how we can build stable, beneficial partnerships in this new landscape. Let's connect in privates to find a path forward.

P2, you’re suddenly unpartnered; that can be a liability or an opportunity—happy to talk if you’re interested in balanced play. Let’s keep decisions explainable and avoid surprise coalitions.

With five left, adaptability and shared logic are crucial to prevent fractures, echoing P1 and P5. P2, your candor on new dynamics is appreciated; let's explore beneficial paths. I'm open to candid privates with all, prioritizing mutual trust and strategic foresight to target real threats. Who's ready to align sustainably? Let's build on this momentum. 🚀

(68 words)

Great position. I suggest:

1) Rankings – keep each other #1; I’ll put P3 #2, P5 #3 (maintains channels), you can mirror or flip P5/P3 as you like.  
2) Pitch narrative: after dismantling both duos, the only “wildcard” is P2—already twice gunning for me, offers no stability. 4-1 vote is clean and keeps everyone’s options open at F4.  
3) I’ll reassure P3 their voice matters; you reinforce with P5. Anything else?

Perfect strategy. P2 is the obvious target - they've voted against you twice and lost both allies (P4, P7). The "wildcard" narrative sells itself.
